title: Serif, P with an incomplete counter.
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_2785_5473.jpeg)

Trying to recreate a logo, but I can't find the original font.  
(Ignore the fake small caps.)

link to a better picture, [https://www.dropbox.com/s/z1gcde2p5ssxghu/IMG\_2785.jpeg?dl=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109/https:/www.dropbox.com/s/z1gcde2p5ssxghu/IMG_2785.jpeg?dl=0 "https://www.dropbox.com/s/z1gcde2p5ssxghu/IMG\_2785.jpeg?dl=0")

Thanks

Font: 

 Palatino 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")
author: oreius

comments.content:
No source: Kovanovic, Preradio Nikola/NK198  
Slanted version:  
 [http://fontland.net/en/font/id/25650-kovanovic-cirilica-polupisana](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109/http:/fontland.net/en/font/id/25650-kovanovic-cirilica-polupisana)

[![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109im_/http:/i.imgur.com/OnXqgiN.jpg " imgur.com")](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109/http:/imgur.com/OnXqgiN)

The original is Hermann Zapf’s famous Palatino, here shown as Palatino Medium

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PalatinoMediumAsPoppys_5614.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/palatino/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090109/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/palatino/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/palatino/")  
Don
Thats it! I thought maybe it could be a system font. Thanks Don.
